description.p: Of the many stops in an adventurer's travel, none is as ubiquitous as a visit to a tavern. Whether searching for rumors and allies, or simply carousing with the fruits of their labor after a hard adventuring day's work, nothing goes down smoother than the first drink of the night. That being so, for the discerning drinker, the best drinks of all are served by those professionally trained in the magical art of mixology, an illustrious echelon that you happen to belong to. From aperitif to digestif, your supernatural cocktail mastery allows for magical mischief.
You gain proficiency with alchemist's supplies and brewer's supplies, and you have advantage on ability checks you make to impress or perform while using those tools.
Additionally, you can use any drinking glass as a spellcasting focus for your bard spells, provided it contains a beverage.

description.p: As an action, while you have alchemist's supplies on your person, you can expend a use of your Bardic Inspiration to mix a magical cocktail, choosing from the options on the Magical Cocktail table. A creature can drink such a cocktail as a bonus action, becoming magically tipsy for 1 minute. When it becomes tipsy, and at the start of each of its turns for the duration, it must roll one of your Bardic Inspiration dice. On a result of 4 or higher, it gains the benefits of the cocktail until the start of its next turn. On a result of 3 or lower, it becomes poisoned until the start of its next turn. A tipsy creature can use an action to sober itself, ending the cocktail's effects.

You can have a number of magical cocktails at any given time equal to your Charisma modifier, and they lose their potency after you finish a long rest. If you would exceed this number, the oldest cocktail loses its potency.

tr.td: The creature gains one Metamagic option of its choice (as per the sorcerer class feature), and using a Metamagic option requires 1 fewer sorcery points for it.
The creature gains a number of temporary hit points equal to your level, and it has resistance to all damage while it has temporary hit points.
The creature's speed is doubled, and it gains the benefits of the Dodge action.
When the creature takes the Attack action on its turn, it can make one additional attack as part of that action.

description.p: When you a mix a magical cocktail, you can choose a bard spell you know and expend a spell slot of its level or higher, imbuing the cocktail with the spell until it loses potency. The spell can't be a cantrip, and must have a casting time of 1 action or bonus action. If the spell requires material components with a gold cost or that would be expended, you must also provide those components. When a creature drinks this cocktail, it becomes the target of the spell, using your spell save DC and spellcasting ability modifier. If the spell requires concentration, the creature must provide that concentration.
